children.text: The bed joints in the adjacent sections of brickwork in this area have not been constructed to align horizontally in the same plane.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 3.14 Horizontal alignment of bed joints states that
‘Bed joints in walls including adjacent isolated piers and either side of openings and control joints are defective if they are not on the same horizontal plane’.
These areas of the brickwork will need to be reconstructed in accordance with above.
